sub_title: Attorney at Law (Amsterdam and Paris) - Dutch corporate and commercial law - cross-border dispute resolution
summary:
Bert Kerkman is a Netherlands attorney specialized in Netherlands corporate law, commercial law and insolvency law, and complex cross-border dispute resolution.  A member of the Amsterdam Bar and of the Paris Bar, he has worked as an associate and partner with large Netherlands and U.S. law firms prior to founding his own firm in Amsterdam.

Bert has many years of experience representing international businesses regarding their corporate and commercial matters in The Netherlands. His clients are multinational companies, many of which are based in North America and in French speaking jurisdictions , with activities in a variety of industries, including banking and finance, capital goods, aeronautics, and international trade and distribution. 

Bert received a degree in Dutch Civil Law and Commercial Law from the University of Utrecht Law School, The Netherlands. Post graduate studies were completed at the University of Amsterdam,  Erasmus University of Rotterdam, and Université du Panthéon-Assas Paris II. He also obtained the qualification certificate of the Netherlands Association for International Trade Lawyers (NAVIH) as well as the Grotius-Insolad qualification certificate in Netherlands insolvency law. 

In addition to his activities as an attorney, Bert is a substitute Judge in the District Courts of The Netherlands, and acts as an ad-hoc arbitrator in commercial disputes. 

Bert is a member of the American Bar Association, the Association for International Arbitration (AIA), the  Netherlands association for civil litigation law (NvvP), the Netherlands association for corporate litigation (Vereniging Corporate Litigation), and the association for  distribution, franchise and commercial agency law (DFA).

He speaks, reads and writes English, French, German, and Dutch professionally, and has knowledge of Spanish, Russian and Afrikaans.
